Question_1.Context: In the study, how did red light exposure affect fungal conidiation and hyphal branching in Shiraia sp. S9?
Question_1.Question: What were the effects of red light exposure on fungal conidiation and hyphal branching in Shiraia sp. S9?
Question_1.A: Inhibited conidiation and promoted hyphal branching
Question_1.B: Promoted conidiation and inhibited hyphal branching
Question_1.C: Had no effect on conidiation but promoted hyphal branching
Question_1.D: Had no effect on conidiation but inhibited hyphal branching
Question_1.Source: The continuous irradiation with red light suppressed fungal conidiation, promoted hyphal branching.

Question_2.Context: How did the application of a NO donor sodium nitroprusside (SNP) impact fungal conidiation and PQ production in Shiraia sp. S9 under red light exposure?
Question_2.Question: What was the effect of SNP application on fungal conidiation and PQ production in Shiraia sp. S9 under red light exposure?
Question_2.A: Restored conidiation and stimulated PQ production
Question_2.C: Had no effect on conidiation but stimulated PQ production
Question_2.D: Had no effect on conidiation but inhibited PQ production
Question_2.Source: The application of a NO donor sodium nitroprusside (SNP) restored conidiation of Shiraia sp. S9 under red light and stimulated PQ production.

Question_3.Context: What was the role of NO in the regulation of fungal growth and PQ production in Shiraia sp. S9 under red light exposure?
Question_3.Question: How did NO impact fungal growth and PQ production in Shiraia sp. S9 under red light exposure?
Question_3.A: Inhibited fungal growth and PQ production
Question_3.B: Stimulated fungal growth and PQ production
Question_3.C: Had no effect on fungal growth but stimulated PQ production
Question_3.D: Had no effect on fungal growth but inhibited PQ production
Question_3.Source: Red light-induced NO, as a signaling molecule, was involved in the regulation of growth and PQ production in Shiraia sp. S9.

Question_4.Context: How did red light exposure impact the accumulation of individual PQs in Shiraia sp. S9?
Question_4.Question: What was the effect of red light exposure on the accumulation of individual PQs in Shiraia sp. S9?
Question_4.C: Had no effect on the accumulation of individual PQs
Question_4.D: Varied effects on different individual PQs
Question_4.Source: Red light exposure notably boosted the production of red PQ pigments, including HA, HC, and EA-EC in Shiraia sp. S9.

Question_5.Context: What was the impact of NO scavenger cPTIO on fungal conidiation and PQ production in Shiraia sp. S9 under red light exposure?
Question_5.Question: How did the NO scavenger cPTIO affect fungal conidiation and PQ production in Shiraia sp. S9 under red light exposure?
Question_5.A: Restored conidiation and stimulated PQ production
Question_5.C: Had no effect on conidiation but stimulated PQ production
Question_5.D: Had no effect on conidiation but inhibited PQ production
Question_5.Source: The mycelium cultures exposed to red-light in the presence of a sGC inhibitor NS-2028 or a NO scavenger cPTIO significantly decreased the contents of individual PQs.

Question_6.Context: How did red light exposure affect the membrane permeability of Shiraia sp. S9?
Question_6.Question: What was the impact of red light exposure on the membrane permeability of Shiraia sp. S9?
Question_6.C: Had no effect on membrane permeability
Question_6.D: Varied effects on different membrane components
Question_6.Source: Red light exposure induced the production of other signal molecules, such as eATP and Ca2+, and enhanced membrane permeability in Shiraia sp. S9.

Question_7.Context: What was the role of NO in red light-induced PQ biosynthesis in Shiraia sp. S9?
Question_7.Question: How did NO contribute to red light-induced PQ biosynthesis in Shiraia sp. S9?
Question_7.C: Had no effect on PQ biosynthesis
Question_7.Source: NO can act as a signal molecule with eATP and Ca2+, working synergistically to enhance the biosynthesis of HA under red light conditions.

Question_8.Context: What was the effect of the combined treatment of red light and SNP on HA production in Shiraia sp. S9?
Question_8.Question: How did the combined treatment of red light and SNP impact HA production in Shiraia sp. S9?
Question_8.C: Had no effect on HA production
Question_8.D: Varied effects on different stages of HA production
Question_8.Source: The synergistic combination of red light exposure and NO donor SNP treatment amplified the stimulation of HA production in Shiraia mycelium culture.

Question_9.Context: What were the effects of red light exposure on fungal biomass and HA production in Shiraia sp. S9?
Question_9.Question: How did red light exposure impact fungal biomass and HA production in Shiraia sp. S9?
Question_9.A: Decreased fungal biomass and HA production
Question_9.B: Increased fungal biomass and HA production
Question_9.C: Had no effect on fungal biomass but increased HA production
Question_9.D: Had no effect on fungal biomass but decreased HA production
Question_9.Source: Red light exposure promoted the accumulation of fungal PQs, including HA, HC, and EA-EC, in Shiraia sp. S9.

Question_10.Context: What was the impact of NO scavenger cPTIO on fungal HA production in Shiraia sp. S9 under red light exposure?
Question_10.Question: How did the NO scavenger cPTIO affect fungal HA production in Shiraia sp. S9 under red light exposure?
Question_10.C: Had no effect on HA production
Question_10.D: Varied effects on different stages of HA production
Question_10.Source: The red light-induced expressions of HA biosynthetic genes and HA production were markedly inhibited by the NO scavenger cPTIO.
